document_data.name: Makeup
document_data.mainbody: '''Makeup''' was a term used for a wide variety of materials and substances, including powders and [[oil]]s, that were applied to faces, usually for the purpose of coloring and beautifying them. Those who were skilled in applying makeup to the face of others were referred to as "makeup artists".
document_data.Description: Makeup was widely varied in form and application. Some substances, such as [[coal]] dust and [[tar]], were used to blacken facial features, add dramatic lines, or to better conceal themselves in darkness. Conversely, some substances were used for the purposes of lightening features, such as [[flour]]. Some were used to add color, such as the [[cochineal]] powder of [[Maztica]], which used to redden lips and cheeks. Makeup could also include skin putty, which was used to add circles beneath ones eyes or make their nose appear longer, and oil to add a sheen of gloss to one's skin.

Varieties.Cochineal: A powder used on the lips and cheeks in Maztica, made from an endemic species of insects of the same name.
Varieties.Kohl: a thick black powder that was used by women in the land of [[Zakhara]].{{cite book/Arabian Adventures|89}}
Varieties.Lampblack: a substance that was used by some [[thieves]] for the purposes of better concealing themselves within darkness.{{Cite polyhedron/91/The Living City: The Swineherd's House|19}}
Varieties.Mrathaera: lip glosses that were designed to dye, flavor, or scent the lips.{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2010)/03-21 - Lip Balms, Dyes, Glosses}}
Varieties.Tar makeup: a makeup crafted from the substance of the same name that was similarly used for concealment purposes.

document_data.Availability:
* In the city of [[Athkatla]], makeup "touchover lasses" were often found congregating around the [[Flamewater Fountain]].
* ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-universe)|Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'' sold general makeup kits under its "Bards' Emporium" section for 25 [[gold piece]]s, as well as a [[jar]] of tar makeup under its "Thieves' Corner" section for 3 gp.
* The [[Fellowship of Bards, Performers and Artists|Bards Guild]] of [[Ravens Bluff]] was host to a great deal of [[thespian]]s that were considered to be the best makeup artists in the city and earned a lot of coin from doing the makeup of the vainer lords and ladies of the city prior to public ceremonies or important revels.
* [[Facemaker's Boutique]], a clothing store in [[Baldur's Gate]] that helped its customers with makeup and other cosmetic services.
* [[Yathla Oloryn]], an expert makeup maker that lived in the city-state of [[Calaunt]] around [[1358 DR]].

Usages.Magic: * ''[[Friends]]'' required a spellcaster to apply makeup to their own face. Older versions of the [[spell]] specifically required the use of lampblack.

Notable Users.Individuals: * [[Pristoleph]], a [[fire genasi]] that applied makeup in an effort to pass himself off as a [[human]] of [[Chondathan]] ethnicity.
Notable Users.Races & Sentient Creatures:
* The [[Reigar]], a race of androgynous spacefaring [[humanoid]]s, widely used makeup and attached no [[gender and sex|gender]] distinctions towards it.
* [[Vampire]]s sometimes wore blush and makeup in order to conceal their [[undead]] nature.
Notable Users.Regions, Nations, & Settlements:
* In the nation of [[Thay]], those of poorer standing sometimes used makeup to draw temporary designs on their shaved heads in lieu of the the [[tattoo]]s that were widespread in the nation.
* In the [[Netherese Empire]], it was quite common for people to heavily apply makeup.
